intro: Symphytum sylvaticum var. hordokopii, commonly known as the Hordokopii comfrey, is a variant of the comfrey plant native to Central Europe. It is a perennial herb characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy blue-violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its thick, succulent stems and roots. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. The species is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
